Thanks for the A2A. No stranger on Quora knows you better than you. It’s not up to us to tell you when to buy a new phone, and you should be able to figure this out for yourself: you buy a new iPhone when you either want or need a new iPhone. It really isn’t any harder than that. How do you know when you need a new iPhone? You will know you need a new iPhone when something goes wrong with your old iPhone. If nothing goes wrong with your old iPhone, you may decide it’s time to get a new iPhone when the battery life gets bad enough to bother you. Of course, you could just get a new battery for your iPhone for about $80, which would be a lot cheaper than a new iPhone. You may also decide you need a new iPhone when things seem to happen a lot slower than they used to. This typically happens when either storage gets too full (which you might remedy by getting rid of stuff), or when the new features in the current version of iOS simply are overwhelming the processor in the older phone. But only you can decide when you think that is happening. Everyone’s tolerance for that is different. In terms of just wanting a new iPhone, only you can make that determination.
